This is very cool. Had a chance to see it in College Park and at Space City. Do you guys have a more detailed CAD or images of how the 2 end effectors are integrated? Any images of how the elevator is mounted would also be great.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-31T19:26:21.912Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":20.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497218,"topic_slug":"7492-cavbots-technical-handbook","display_username":"Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63122,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/7492-cavbots-technical-handbook/497218/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3599308,"name":"daniella ddddddddd","username":"Didi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/didi/{size}/208812_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T00:23:22.223Z","cooked":"

Sorry for being the worlds slowest replier . But here are some pictures with explanation:

IMG_18201920×2560 378 KB

For the arm, there are 2 gussets riveted to the inner frame of the carriage, where it then connect to the tubing by two REV endcaps, which carries a maxspline bearing for the algae arm and also has the motor attached to it.

IMG_18221920×2560 322 KB

For the coral cage, its a similar deal except 4 gussets connect to two 1x1 tubes, which are then connected to the cage’s polycarb by bolts.

The elevator is mounted via 2x2 MaxTube, which has bolts running into endcaps for the outside stage of the elevator. It’s reinforced by 2 3/8" hex shafts running from the frame towards the top of the elevator.

IMG_17801920×2560 491 KB
